org.extract.dbtools
Class DatabaseQueries

java.lang.Object
  org.extract.dbtools.DatabaseQueries

public class DatabaseQueries
extends java.lang.Object

This class generates basic prepared statement for insert, delete, select, selectAll, update, deleteAndReset and exist. All of the functions take in String table name, HasMaps for items to be inserted and HashMap for items conditions, and String condition operator. The HashMaps are set as String being place holder for column names and Objects as Values
It is also designed to execute the preparedStatement. In order to construct an object of this class, the constructor with Connection must be used for the prepared statement to execute

Version:
2014-11-19
Author:
Devesh

          Parameterized constructor: set up database connection
 
Method Summary
 boolean deleteAndReset(java.lang.String tableName)
          Deletes all the contents of the table and resets any auto_increment number to 1, should not be used if auto_increment no is foreign key to other tables.
 boolean deleteRow(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> condition, java.lang.String operator)
          generate delete sql query, ex: DELETE FROM tableName WHERE columnName1 = val1 and columnName2 = value2;
delete condition must be passed in HashMap format
 boolean exists(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> condition, java.lang.String operator)
          Check for existing record
 java.sql.ResultSet insertIntoTable(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> tableContents)
          generates insert sql query, eg: INSERT INTO tableName set columnName1 = val1, columnName2 = val2;
column names and corresponding value must be passed through HashMap
 java.sql.ResultSet insertIntoTableIfNotExist(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> tableContents, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> condition, java.lang.String operator)
          insert if record does not exists
column names and corresponding value must be passed through HashMap
 java.sql.ResultSet select(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> columns, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> condition, java.lang.String operator)
          generate select sql query, eg: SELECT column1, columne2 FROM tableName WHERE columnxx = valxx and columnyy = valyy;
select should in HashSet format as second arg and condition in HashMap as third args
 java.sql.ResultSet selectAllRows(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> columns)
          select all row
 void setConnection(java.sql.Connection conn)
          If the object is made with default constructor, the connection has to be set through this function
 boolean updateTable(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> changes, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> condition, java.lang.String operator)
          generate update sql query, ex: UPDATE tableName SET columnName1 = yval1, columnName2 = val2 where columnxx = valxx and columnyy = valy;
The updates must be passed through HashMap as second argument and condition as third argument
